=== eSpeak new voices project ===

For Ubuntu Feisty Fawn we plan to migrate to eSpeak as our primary Text To Speech (TTS) engine. This will help us implement our plans for a multilingual Live CD and default install. eSpeak already has voices available in several languages, with varying degree of completeness. The aim of the eSpeak Voices project is to extend the existing voices (languages) and add new ones.

==== Available voices ====

A list of currently available voices. ''(Incomplete)'' There is an attempt to indicate the maturity of the voice with ''Preliminary, Fair, Good, etc.'' Many voices could benefit from tweaking by native speakers.

=== Documentation ===

==== Getting started ====

If your language is available as an eSpeak voice you should test it out as a first step. Start by installing eSpeak (from universe):

<code>apt-get install espeak</code>

Then feed it some sample text strings:

<code>espeak -v xx "<native language text string>"</code>

where <code>xx</code> is a language code like <code>de</code> or <code>pl</code>. You'll soon discover whether the quality is already good or could use some work.
